Sequence Information.Peptide Name: PxMor2 (P. xylostella Moricin 2, natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals, UCLL1a; PxMor2=PxMor1)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (95.24%) toPx-MorA variant. Note that the two variants PxMor1 and PxMor2 share the same sequence. G: 17%; V: 14%; A=N=R: 12%. GRAVY: -0.49; mol Wt: 4449.109; mol formula: C191H329N65O53; mol ex coeff: 1490.Activity: active against Gram- E. coli (MIC 37.3 ug/ml), P.aeruginosa (MIC 1192.8 ug/ml), S.marcescens (MIC 1192.8 ug/ml), Gram+ S. aureus (MIC 74.6 ug/ml), and B.cereus (MIC 1192.8 ug/ml).Structure:  it is random coiled in water and helical (91.7%) in 30 mM SDS.Recombinant production:bacteria:Escherichia coli: pET-32a(1) plasmid, expressed as a fusion with thioredoxin, His-tag purification, enterokinase cleaved.MOA:bacteria:E. coli: MOA:bacteria:S. aureus: acted on membranes.
Literature Information.Author: Xia XF, Li Y, Yu XQ, Lin JH, Li SY, Li Q, You MS. 2017
Literature Information.Title: Cloning and functional identification of moricins from the diamondback moth, Plutella xylostella (L.).
